intro: Dracaenopsis indivisa, commonly known as the star-shaped dracaena, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-like arrangement of dark green, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements. Dracaenopsis indivisa thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil.
